reviews.review_msg: Lectures were solid. He really knows his stuff. Students can learn a lot if they come to his lectures, though he prints his lecture notes and so many students do not show and miss out. My only complaint are his tests. Several short answer questions on both the mid-term & final, imo, do not properly gauge students' learning of the course material.

This prof provides notes that have unreadable handwritings, therefore it is hard to read off them. He doesn't type out his notes. The exams were hard and contains a lot of theories and graphs which were "outside-of-the-box" - it's not on the textbook. His lectures were boring and easily skippable as his voice will make you fall asleep. Avoid D COX!
Worst prof ever met, and his lecture is so boring. Basically what he do is just reading his hand written lecture notes. The best thing of class is the classroom, help me get sleep easily.

You can tell that prof. cox is trying to not be boring. he inflects his voice and gives real-life examples. In spite of which, every time he speaks, I just want to go to sleep. The good thing is that he gives you notes so that you don't have to read the textbook. Stil, it's best not to take his classes. He's the most boring prof I've ever had
Easy course, but makes it hard. mid term is fair but final is not really relevant to the material covered in class. Lectures are heavy.

THE question on midterm you have never seem before, you do't even know what's the question asked. the exam will be harder in the next, if you wanna challenge yourself, you can try, he almost fail 20% every semester

I absolutely love Dave Cox! He is very clear and detailed on his notes and you need a book only for reference. It is really helpful reading his notes carefully for exams. Fair exams, mosly directly from lecture notes and no surprising material. He is nice too! Fair marker as well! I actually learn a lot at this course and will take his course again
He is a really nice prof, just attend the lecture and do the practice problem, you can get a good grade

VERY VERY BAD ENGLISH. His tests are so easy the class scaling may screw you over. Overall, I stopped attending lectures simply because he would just read his lecture notes out loud word for word. It's pretty annoying as well when he writes down an equation that's already written on the notes in front of you. Useless prof!
Highly reccomend this course to econ major students. Pretty straightforward. Have weekly quizes and readings but east to keep up. Just read the slides and go through review questions for exams.
Super easy course and chill professor - don't miss the tutorials!

The person who below most likely is lying about their grade. The class is graded on a midterm and final (90% in total). John's lectures are very heavy with material, he avoids calculus as much as possible. He gives you old exams to study and they're very similar in nature. Overall, he's not as bad as people say and the class is relatively easy.

My midterm and final were both well above average, and his class average was a B+, but when I asked him why I got a B, he gave me the response that his grade was in the B range, which was surprising. By the way for students who did not get good grades in the midterm, he deferred them to the end of the period, which is not a fair approach. Stay away

John's lectures are pretty dry but his examinations are more than fair! You really just need to read the textbook and you're good to go. His review questions are relevant and his teaching is clear. Would reccommend
